import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
source.3f954400:
data = pd.read_csv('/kaggle/input/world-happiness/2019.csv') ## I choose the dataset from 2019
data.head(10)
source.7da79bfc:
f,ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 10))
sns.heatmap(data.corr(), annot=True, linewidths=.5, fmt= '.1f',ax=ax)
plt.show()
source.2fe8ce00:
# Let's do plots! First, line pilot

data.Generosity.plot(color = 'g',label = 'Generosity',linewidth=1, grid = True,linestyle = '-')
plt.legend(loc='upper right')     # legend = puts label into plot
plt.xlabel('Countries')              # label = name of label
plt.ylabel('Generosity')
plt.title('Generosity across Countries')            # title = title of plot
plt.show()
source.c2950554:
# Now a scatter Plot
data.plot(kind='scatter', x='Score', y='Generosity',alpha = 0.5,color = 'blue')
# Alternatively you could write: plt.scatter(data.Attack,data.Defense,alpha = 0.5,color = 'red')
plt.xlabel('Score')              # label = name of label
plt.ylabel('Generosity')
plt.title('Score vs Generosity')            # title = title of plot
plt.show()
